translationBlock.key: Find a bug in this page? %sEdit this page yourself, then submit a pull request.%s (Note this page is automatically generated from the documentation in the source code.)
Sorry, there are no examples for this function! :(

Replaces all the colorizable text in the string. For instance, colorize('&aText') would be equivalent to (color('a').'Text'). By default, the symbol is '&', but that can be any arbitrary string that you specify. If text is not a string, that value is simply returned. If you need to "escape" a symbol, (that is have a literal symbol followed by a letter that is a valid color) just repeat the symbol twice, for instance '&&c' would return a literal '&c' instead of a red modifier.
